cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to cross south Florida Saturday, emerge into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico, then track northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL coast) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast between southeast Louisiana and coastal Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for the north-central Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for the north-central Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle westward to southeast Louisiana, including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: 28% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; 7% chance of ≥50 kt winds. Gusty easterly winds could reach 40–50 mph in squalls late Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early NHC guidance suggests the potential for 3–5 ft of surge in and near Mobile Bay if the center makes landfall west of the port Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood risk around Mobile Sunday night through Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and hazardous seas (10–15 ft) over coastal waters will impact port operations.
